sceneDescription.title: Nero's Suicide in Villa During Storm

setting.location: Alban Hills outside Rome, exposed hilltop with scattered trees
setting.weather: Severe thunderstorm with lightning, driving rain, strong winds

characters.appearance: Emperor Nero in his thirties, corpulent build now showing fear, cruel face distorted by terror of approaching death
characters.clothing: Purple imperial robes disheveled and stained, golden laurel crown askew, jeweled rings on trembling hands
characters.position: Cowering in modest villa outside Rome, abandoned by Praetorian Guard
characters.action: Preparing for suicide as rebels approach, dagger in shaking hands, reciting theatrical lines about artist's death

scene.mainElements: Dramatic lightning bolt illuminating entire landscape for split second, bent trees lashing in wind, sheep huddled together for protection
scene.details: World visible only in brief lightning flashes then plunging back to darkness, rain falling in sheets at sharp angle, thunder immediately following lightning showing storm center overhead, wind so strong grass and bushes flattened, temporary rivers forming from rainfall, air electric with storm energy
scene.background: Hills and valleys revealed momentarily in lightning then disappearing, Rome invisible in distance behind storm, sky filled with churning black clouds
scene.atmosphere: Divine justice unleashed through human rebellion, tyrant's vulnerability exposed, world transformed by overthrow of evil, dramatic end of imperial madness amid storm of retribution

composition.cameraAngle: Wide shot capturing lightning bolt illuminating entire scene
composition.focus: Crouched figure and flock revealed in brief lightning flash
composition.depth: Foreground wind-lashed vegetation, middle ground huddled figures behind boulder, background hills visible in lightning moment
